list.title: AABB
list.description: Create an AABB using centre position, width, and height.

list.title: AABB#contains
list.description: Check if this AABB contains a {@link Vector}.

list.title: AABB#intersects
list.description: Check if this AABB intersects another AABB.

list.title: AABB#lines
list.description: Create an array of [Lines]{@link Line} containing one line for each side of the AABB.

list.title: AABB.fromCorners
list.description: Create an AABB from four corner [Vectors]{@link Vector}.

list.title: Circle
list.description: Create a circle.

list.title: Circle.fromVector
list.description: Create a circle from a Vector object and a radius.

list.title: LCG
list.description: This class provides the LCG algorithm for generating psuedorandom numbers to the {@link PRNG} class.

list.title: LCG#next
list.description: Generates the next pseudorandom number.

list.title: Line
list.description: Create a line between two [Vectors]{@link Vector}.

list.title: Line#intersects
list.description: Check if this line intersects another shape. Currently only {@link Line} is supported.

list.title: Line#isContainedBy
list.description: Check if this line lies directly on top of a longer line.

list.title: Line#isDuplicate
list.description: Check if this line is the same as another line.

list.title: Line#length
list.description: Get the length.

list.title: Line.fromArray
list.description: Create a Line from an array of numbers.

list.title: Line.lineIntersection
list.description: Check if two lines intersect.

list.title: Matrix#add
list.description: Element-wise addition

list.title: Matrix#scale
list.description: Scalar multiplication

list.title: Mulberry32
list.description:
This class provides the Mulberry32 method of generating psuedorandom numbers to the {@link PRNG} class.

The Mulberry32 algorithm was written by Tommy Ettinger in 2017 and is released to the public domain, meaning it can be freely used, modified, and distributed without restrictions.

list.title: Mulberry32#next
list.description: Generates the next psuedo-random number.

list.title: PAPER
list.description: Pre-defined paper sizes.

list.title: PRNG
list.description: Creates an instance of PRNG.

list.title: PRNG#randomBipolarFloat
list.description: Generate a random float in the range [-1, 1).

list.title: PRNG#randomChance
list.description: Returns a boolean based on a specified probability.

list.title: PRNG#randomElement
list.description: Select a random element from an array.

list.title: PRNG#randomFloat
list.description: Generate a random float in the range [0, 1).

list.title: PRNG#randomGaussian
list.description:
Generate a random float that fits a normal distribution.

The most likely values are at the mean. The standard deviation describes the spread of the distribution.

With a mean of 0, and standard deviation of 1 (default values);

  • 68% of results fall within +/- 1
  • 95% of results fall within +/- 2
  • 99% of results fall within +/- 3

list.title: PRNG#randomInteger
list.description: Generate a random integer from a specified range of values.

list.title: PRNG#randomUnitVector
list.description: Generate a random unit vector.

list.title: PRNG#randomVectorInAABB
list.description: Generate a random vector within an AABB.

list.title: PRNG#randomWeighted
list.description: Selects an option probabalistically from a set of weighted choices.

list.title: PRNGAlgorithm
list.description: A PRNGAlgorithm is a class that implements some technique for random number generation. It should have a seed and max value, as well as a next function.

list.title: Paper
list.description: Creates a new Paper instance.

list.title: Paper#landscape
list.description: Returns the paper dimensions in landscape. If the height is greater than the width, it swaps them.

list.title: Paper#portrait
list.description: Returns the paper dimensions in portrait. If the height is smaller than the width, it swaps them.

list.title: Plot#addCirclesToSVG
list.description: Adds the [Circles]{@link Circle} in this Plot's circles array to it's SVG element.

list.title: Plot#addLinesToSVG
list.description: Adds the [Lines]{@link Line} in this Plot's lines array to it's SVG element.

list.title: Plot#addPathsToSVG
list.description: Adds the [Paths]{@link Path} in this Plot's paths array to it's SVG element.

list.title: Plot#addSingleShape
list.description: Adds a single shape to the appropriate array. Used by {@link Plot#add}.

list.title: Plot#appendSVG
list.description: Appends this plot's SVG element to the document body.

list.title: Plot#clear
list.description: Empty out any existing HTML UI and SVG document elements on the page, in order to regenerate a Plot.

list.title: Plot#createUI
list.description: Creates HTML UI and adds it to the document body.

list.title: Plot#deduplicateLines
list.description: Removes duplicated [Lines]{@link Line} from this Plot's lines array.

list.title: Plot#downloadSVG
list.description: Download the {@link Plot} as an SVG file.

list.title: Plot#draw
list.description: Generates the SVG and UI and appends them to the document body. Must be called after defining a Plot.generate() function.

list.title: Plot#removeOverlappingLines
list.description: Removes overlapping [Lines]{@link Line} from this Plot's lines array.

list.title: Plot#removeShortLines
list.description: Removes [Lines]{@link Line} in this Plot's lines array that are shorter than a specified minimum length.

list.title: Point
list.description:
Create a Point.

Points are constructed from a {@link Vector} position, a size, and a style.

list.title: Point#toSVGElement
list.description:
Converts the Point to an SVGElement.

This method is used by {@link Plot#add}.

list.title: Quadtree
list.description: Create a quadtree.

list.title: Quadtree#insert
list.description: Add a point into this quadtree.

list.title: Quadtree#query
list.description: Check for points in a given range and return them in an array.

list.title: Quadtree#show
list.description: For each boundary of this quadtree and all it's children, create [Lines]{@link Line} from those rectangles and add them to a {@link Plot}.

list.title: Triangle
list.description: Create a triangle.

list.title: Triangle#getCentroid
list.description: Find the centroid of a Triangle.

list.title: Triangle#getMidpoints
list.description: Find the midpoints of a Triangle.

list.title: Triangle#lines
list.description: Create an array of [Lines]{@link Line} containing a line for each side of the Triangle.

list.title: Vector
list.description: Create a vector from coordinates.

list.title: Vector#add
list.description: Add a vector to this vector.

list.title: Vector#clone
list.description: Make a copy of this vector.

list.title: Vector#distance
list.description: Calculate the distance to another vector from this vector

list.title: Vector#distanceSquared
list.description: Get the distance squared to another vector from this one.

list.title: Vector#equals
list.description: Check if this vector is equivalent to another vector.

list.title: Vector#getAngle
list.description: Get the 2D angle of this vector with respect to the positive x-axis.

list.title: Vector#getMagnitude
list.description: Get the magnitude of this 2D vector.

list.title: Vector#getMagnitudeSquared
list.description: Get the magnitude squared of this vector. This is faster than [getMagnitude]{@link Vector#getMagnitude} because it avoids using the square root.

list.title: Vector#isOnLine
list.description: Check if this vector is a point on a {@link Line}.

list.title: Vector#multiply
list.description: Multiply this vector by a scalar.

list.title: Vector#nearestNeighbour
list.description: Finds the n nearest neighbours to this vector, from a given array of vectors.

list.title: Vector#normalize
list.description: Normalize this vector by setting it's magnitude to 1.

list.title: Vector#rotate
list.description: Rotate this 2D vector by a specified angle.

list.title: Vector#setMagnitude
list.description: Set the magnitude of this vector.

list.title: Vector#subtract
list.description: Subtract a vector from this vector.

list.title: Vector#toArray
list.description: Create an array from the vector's components.

list.title: Vector.add
list.description: Add two vectors.

list.title: Vector.cross
list.description: Calculate the cross product of two 2D vectors.

list.title: Vector.distance
list.description: Calculate the distance between two vectors.

list.title: Vector.distanceSquared
list.description: Calculate the distance squared between two vectors.

list.title: Vector.dot
list.description: Calculate the dot product of two vectors.

list.title: Vector.fromAngle
list.description: Create a 2D vector from an angle.

list.title: Vector.fromArray
list.description: Create a vector from an array.

list.title: Vector.lerp
list.description: Linear interpolation between vectors.

list.title: Vector.subtract
list.description: Subtract two vectors.

list.title: XORShift32
list.description:
This class provides the XORShift32 method of generating psuedorandom numbers to the {@link PRNG} class. It uses bitwise operations to generate a sequence of pseudorandom 32-bit unsigned integers.

The XORShift algorithm was written by George Marsaglia in 2003 and is released to the public domain, meaning it can be freely used, modified, and distributed without restrictions.

list.title: XORShift32#next
list.description: Generates the next psuedo-random number.

list.title: decToHex
list.description: Convert a decimal number into a hexadecimal string.

list.title: hexToDec
list.description: Convert a hexadecimal string to a decimal number.

list.title: lerp
list.description: Linear interpolation between two values

list.title: map
list.description: Re-maps a number from one range to another.

list.title: sinFract
list.description: Generates pseudo-random numbers from x and y co-ordinates. This technique is adapted from The Art of Code's YouTube video on value noise.

list.title: unseededRandomHex
list.description: Uses Math.random() to make a hexadecimal string for setting the seed of a {@link Plot} to be used in a seedable {@link PRNG} such as {@link LCG}

list.title: wrap
list.description: Constrain an input number to within a specified range, and wrapping it around to min when it exceeds max (and vice versa)
